intro: Lobostemon virgatus, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray, hairy leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are borne in clusters and bloom during the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lobostemon virgatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to Mediterranean climates.
